newsitem.title: USA: PC Quote auditors concerned about firm.
newsitem.headline: PC Quote auditors concerned about firm.

text.p: PC Quote Inc, which is in talks with parties interested in acquiring or investing in its businesses, said its independent auditors have raised concerns about the company's ability to continue operating.

The auditor's report, contained in a recent Securities and Exchange Commission filing, said PC Quote has experienced "significant operating losses, which has adversely affected the company's current results of operations and liquidity."
"These conditions raise substantial doubt about the company's ability to continue as a going concern," the report said.
PC Quote provides real-time securities quotations and news.

In the SEC filing, the company said its cash flow from operating activities declined to levels expected to be insufficient. In February, it hired William Blair & Co as a financial consultant to explore ways to raise capital.

"Such a transaction might include a merger, a sale of substantially all or part of the company's assets, a strategic relationship or joint venture with another technology or financial service firm," PC Quote said in the filing.

If the company is not able to secure additional capital, lack of funds may "significantly limit the company's ability to realize value from its assets and its product offerings, and its ability to continue its business as currently conducted," PC Quote said.

The company reported a net loss for 1996 of $3.3 million or $0.45 a share, compared with income in 1995 of $1.5 million or $0.21 a share. For the fourth quarter of 1996, it had a net loss of $2.2 million, or $0.30 a share.

In a statement issued late Monday, PC Quote said net losses for the fourth quarter and full-year 1996 were due to increased infrastructure expenses and Internet product start-up costs, as well as higher communications expenses and increased equipment leasing costs.
Chairman Louis Morigan said the company had received a non-binding letter of intent from an investor and was in discussions with other potential investors for its Internet business.

Morgan said the company is focusing its operations in the coming year on growing Internet business opportunities.

He said the potential buyers of PC Quote's traditional business have expressed intent to carry on the HyperFeed service. "Additionally, potential buyers would grant the company the right to continue to use HyperFeed to power its Internet offerings," he said.
